To understand the case turnover and transmissibility of COVID-19, the serial interval (S I) from the onset of illness in a primary case to the onset of illness in a secondary case is important.
49 Recent studies estimated the average S I for COVID-19 as 3.77 (2.23–4.82) days.
49 – 51 A shorter S I makes COVID-19 harder to contain and more likely to rapidly transmit within populations ( Figure 6).
